servicePlans.name: 16_abap_64_db
servicePlans.description: Provides a 16 GB ABAP runtime with 64 GB database. No additional sizing possible. This service plan was deprecated. It has been replaced by service plans Standard, ABAP Compute Unit and HANA Compute Unit.

admin_employee_id.title: Admin Employee ID
admin_employee_id.description: Optionally enter the Employee ID of the initial administrator. The Employee ID must only contain uppercase letters, digits, underscores, hyphens and periods, and must not be longer than 60 characters.

description.title: ABAP System Description
description.description: Enter a description for the ABAP system

sapsystemname.title: ABAP System ID
sapsystemname.description: Enter a valid system ID (SID) for the ABAP system. The ID must consist of exactly three alphanumeric characters. Only uppercase letters are allowed. The first character must be a letter (not a digit). The ID does not have to be technically unique. The following IDs are reserved and cannot be used: ADD ALL AMD AND ANY ARE ASC AUX AVG BIT CDC COM CON DBA END EPS FOR GET GID IBM INT KEY LOG LPT MAP MAX MIN MON NIX NOT NUL OFF OLD OMS OUT PAD PRN RAW REF ROW SAP SET SGA SHG SID SQL SUM SYS TMP TOP UID USE USR VAR.

is_development_allowed.title: Development System
is_development_allowed.description: Specify, if development shall be allowed on this ABAP system

size_of_runtime.title: Total ABAP Runtime Size (size_of_runtime) in ACU
size_of_runtime.description: Enter the total number of ABAP compute units (1 ACU = 1 block of 16 GB) that should be used for the ABAP runtime over all application servers. If elastic scaling is disabled, this value represents the fixed size of the ABAP runtime. If elastic scaling is enabled, this value represents the maximum size of the ABAP runtime.

size_of_persistence.title: HANA Cloud Memory Size (size_of_persistence) in HCU
size_of_persistence.description: Enter the number of HANA compute units (1 HCU = 1 block of 16 GB on Azure and GCP, or 15 GB on AWS) that should be used for the HANA Cloud memory

elastic.title: Elastic Scaling of ABAP Application Server
elastic.description: Enable or disable elastic scaling for the ABAP system. When disabled, the service instance will have a fixed number of ABAP Application Servers with a total ABAP runtime size as defined by the parameter size_of_runtime. When enabled, the number of ABAP Application Servers will be dynamically adjusted based on the system load with the size_of_runtime parameter representing the maximum size of the ABAP runtime. In this case only the actually allocated ACUs and not the configured maximum will be charged at any time.

size_of_persistence.title: HANA Cloud Memory Size (size_of_persistence) in HCU
size_of_persistence.description: Enter the number of HANA compute units (1 HCU = 1 block of 16 GB on Azure and GCP, or 15 GB on AWS) that should be used for the HANA Cloud memory. Keep in mind that the minimum and maximum value for the 'size_of_persistence_disk' will be recalculated depending on the new 'size_of_persistence', but that the 'size_of_persistence_disk' itself cannot be decreased. This means that 0.002 of HANA compute unit quota will be consumed by the HANA Cloud disk for any GB exceeding the new minimum 'size_of_persistence_disk'.

elastic.description: Enable or disable elastic scaling for the ABAP system. When enabled, the number of ABAP Application Servers will be dynamically adjusted based on the system load with the size_of_runtime parameter representing the maximum size of the ABAP runtime. servicePlans.name: abap_compute_unit
servicePlans.description: Allows you to configure runtime memory, which refers to volatile memory used during the execution of applications. This memory provides fast read and write access but loses all data when the system is restarted or shut down. The metric measures the amount of runtime memory used in 16 GB blocks on an hourly basis. It is mandatory to assign a combination of three entitlement service plans: ABAP Compute Unit, HANA Compute Unit, and either the Free, Standard, or SaaS OEM plan.

servicePlans.name: free
servicePlans.description: For small proof-of-concept development projects. Also can be used for the piloting of a remote ABAP test cockpit scenario against on-premise systems in the Custom Code Migration app. The instance will be stopped each night automatically and needs to be started again via the Landscape Portal. Only community support is available for free tier service plans and these are not subject to SLAs.

servicePlans.name: hana_compute_unit
servicePlans.description: Allows you to configure persistent memory, which refers to storage that retains data even after the system is restarted or shut down. The metric measures the amount of persistent storage used in 16 GB blocks on an hourly basis. It is mandatory to assign a combination of three entitlement service plans: ABAP Compute Unit, HANA Compute Unit, and either the Free, Standard, or SaaS OEM plan.

servicePlans.name: saas_oem
servicePlans.description: Allows you to create projects for ABAP systems to run multitenancy SaaS applications. The minimum system size is 2 HANA Compute Units and 1 ABAP Compute Unit. It is mandatory to assign a combination of three entitlement service plans: ABAP Compute Unit, HANA Compute Unit, and either the Free, Standard, or SaaS OEM plan.

size_of_application_server.title: ABAP Runtime Size per Application Server (size_of_application_server) in ACU
size_of_application_server.description: Enter the number of ABAP compute units (1 ACU = 1 block of 16 GB) that should be used for a single application server. If you choose a higher number you will get less but larger application servers while a lower number will give you more but smaller application servers for the same size_of_runtime. If 'auto' is chosen, then 0.5 ACU will be assigned per application server if size_of_runtime < 4 for systems without elastic scaling, or size_of_runtime < 8 for systems with elastic scaling; otherwise 2 ACU will be assigned per application server. Note that the Total ABAP Runtime Size must be a whole-numbered multiple between 2 and 16 times the size of the ABAP Runtime Size per Application Server.

size_of_persistence_disk.title: HANA Cloud Disk Size (size_of_persistence_disk) in GB
size_of_persistence_disk.description: Change the disk size of the HANA database (in GB). If 'auto' is selected it will be set to the minimum value '40 * size_of_persistence + 40'. The maximum value is '120 * size_of_persistence + 40'. It will consume 0.002 of HANA compute unit quota for any GB exceeding the minimum value.

If 'auto' is selected, the size you have set previously will remain unchanged except if it is lower than the minimum value '40 * size_of_persistence + 40', in which case it will be raised to the minimum value automatically. The maximum value is '120 * size_of_persistence + 40'. It will consume 0.002 of HANA compute unit quota for any GB exceeding the minimum value.
